Governing_Law: Section 183 of the PSLRA (Public Service Labour Relations Act)
Evidence_Assessment: Minister lacked key information, such as the PIC report
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate procedural unfairness
Legal_Rule: Duty of procedural fairness requires notice and opportunity to make submissions
Procedural_Issue: Lack of notice and opportunity to respond
Outcome_on_Merits: Decision quashed due to procedural unfairness
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Violation found: Alliance not consulted or notified
Key_Evidence_Considered: Employer's request, absence of PIC report
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged Minister's decision on grounds of fairness, reasonableness, and bias
Court_Result: Decision set aside; vote process stopped
Legal_Rule_Source: PSLRA, common law principles of natural justice
Outcome: Decision quashed, no elevated costs awarded
Remedy_Sought: Injunction to stop vote, declaration of unfairness
Applicable_Process: Administrative decision-making under labour relations legislation
Governing_Rule: Principles of procedural fairness in administrative law
